member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.StockUserErrorIcon
member.summary: Describes a stock error icon situation - it is up to the UI to decide how to interpret these icons.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.IRecoveryCommand
member.summary: A command that represents a recovery from an error. These commands will typically be displayed as buttons in the error dialog.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.IReactiveCommand
member.summary: IReactiveCommand is an Rx-enabled version of ICommand that is also an Observable. Its Observable fires once for each invocation of ICommand.Execute and its value is the CommandParameter that was provided.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.IReactiveCommand.CanExecuteObservable
member.summary: Fires whenever the CanExecute of the ICommand changes. Note that this should not fire notifications unless the CanExecute changes (i.e. it should not fire 'true', 'true').

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.IRecoveryCommand.CommandName
member.summary: The command name, typically displayed as the button text.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.IRecoveryCommand.RecoveryResult
member.summary: When the command is invoked and a result is determined, the command should set the recovery result to indicate the action the throwing code should take.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryOptionResult
member.summary: RecoveryOptionResult describes to the code throwing the UserError what to do once the error is resolved.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryOptionResult.CancelOperation
member.summary: The operation should be cancelled, but it is no longer an error.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryOptionResult.RetryOperation
member.summary: The operation should be retried with the same parameters.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryOptionResult.FailOperation
member.summary: Recovery failed or not possible, you should rethrow as an Exception.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError
member.summary:
User Errors are similar to Exceptions, except that they are intended to be displayed to the user. As such, your error messages should be phrased in a friendly way. When a UserError is thrown, code higher up in the stack has a chance to resolve the UserError via a user interaction.
Code can also add "Recovery Options" which resolve user errors: for example an "Out of Disk Space" error might have an "Open Explorer" recovery option.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.Throw(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initiate a user interaction (i.e. "Throw the error to the user to deal with") - this method is the simplest way to prompt the user that an error has occurred.
member.param: The message to show to the user. The upper level handlers registered with RegisterHandler are ultimately responsible for displaying this information.
The Exception that was thrown, if relevant - this will *not* ever be shown to the user.
member.returns: An Observable representing the action the code should attempt to take, if any.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.Throw(ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError)
member.summary: Initiate a user interaction (i.e. "Throw the error to the user to deal with").
member.param: The UserError to show to the user. The upper level handlers registered with RegisterHandler are ultimately responsible for displaying this information.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.RegisterHandler(System.Func{ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError,System.IObservable{ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryOptionResult}})
member.summary:
Register code to handle a UserError. Registered handlers are called in reverse order to their registration (i.e. the newest handler is called first), and they each have a chance to handle a UserError.
If a Handler cannot resolve a UserError, it should return null instead of an Observable result.
member.param: A method that can handle a UserError, usually by presenting it to the user. If the handler cannot handle the error, it should return null.
member.returns: An IDisposable which will unregister the handler.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.RegisterHandler``1(System.Func{``0,System.IObservable{ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryOptionResult}})
member.summary:
Register code to handle a specific type of UserError. Registered handlers are called in reverse order to their registration (i.e. the newest handler is called first), and they each have a chance to handle a UserError.
If a Handler cannot resolve a UserError, it should return null instead of an Observable result.
member.param: A method that can handle a UserError, usually by presenting it to the user. If the handler cannot handle the error, it should return null.
member.returns: An IDisposable which will unregister the handler.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.RegisterHandler(System.Func{ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryOptionResult}})
member.summary:
Register code to handle a UserError. Registered handlers are called in reverse order to their registration (i.e. the newest handler is called first), and they each have a chance to handle a UserError.
If a Handler cannot resolve a UserError, it should return null instead of an Observable result.
member.param: A method that can handle a UserError, usually by presenting it to the user. If the handler cannot handle the error, it should return null.
member.returns: An IDisposable which will unregister the handler.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.RegisterHandler``1(System.Func{``0,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryOptionResult}})
member.summary:
Register code to handle a specific type of UserError. Registered handlers are called in reverse order to their registration (i.e. the newest handler is called first), and they each have a chance to handle a UserError.
If a Handler cannot resolve a UserError, it should return null instead of an Observable result.
member.param: A method that can handle a UserError, usually by presenting it to the user. If the handler cannot handle the error, it should return null.
member.returns: An IDisposable which will unregister the handler.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.AddRecoveryOption(ReactiveUI.Xaml.IRecoveryCommand,System.Func{ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError,System.Boolean})
member.summary: This method is a convenience wrapper around RegisterHandler that adds the specified RecoveryCommand to any UserErrors that match its filter.
member.param: The RecoveryCommand to add.
An optional filter to determine which UserErrors to add the command to.
member.returns: An IDisposable which will unregister the handler.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.OverrideHandlersForTesting(System.Func{ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError,System.IObservable{ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryOptionResult}})
member.summary: This method replaces *all* UserError handlers with the specified handler. Use it for testing code that may throw UserErrors.
member.param: The replacement UserError handler.
member.returns: An IDisposable which will unregister the test handler.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.OverrideHandlersForTesting(System.Func{ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError,ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryOptionResult})
member.summary: This method replaces *all* UserError handlers with the specified handler. Use it for testing code that may throw UserErrors.
member.param: The replacement UserError handler.
member.returns: An IDisposable which will unregister the test handler.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.Domain
member.summary: The component that originally threw the error - if this is not supplied, it defaults to the assembly name.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.ContextInfo
member.summary: A Dictionary that allows UserErrors to contain arbitrary application data.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.RecoveryOptions
member.summary: The list of available Recovery Options that will be presented to the user to resolve the issue - these usually correspond to buttons in the dialog.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.ErrorMessage
member.summary: The "Newspaper Headline" of the message being conveyed to the user. This should be one line, short, and informative.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.ErrorCauseOrResolution
member.summary: Additional optional information to describe what is happening, or the resolution to an information-only error (i.e. a dialog to tell the user that something has happened)

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.UserErrorIcon
member.summary: This object is either a custom icon (usually an ImageSource), or it can also be a StockUserErrorIcon. It can also be an application-defined type that the handlers know to interpret.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UserError.InnerException
member.summary: Optionally, The actual Exception that warranted throwing the UserError.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.UnhandledUserErrorException
member.summary: This Exception will be thrown when a UserError is not handled by any of the registered handlers.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryCommand
member.summary: RecoveryCommand is a straightforward implementation of a recovery command - this class represents a command presented to the user (usually in the form of a button) that will help resolve or mitigate a UserError.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveCommand
member.summary: IReactiveCommand is an Rx-enabled version of ICommand that is also an Observable. Its Observable fires once for each invocation of ICommand.Execute and its value is the CommandParameter that was provided.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveCommand.#ctor(System.IObservable{System.Boolean},System.Reactive.Concurrency.IScheduler)
member.summary: Creates a new ReactiveCommand object.
member.param: An Observable, often obtained via ObservableFromProperty, that defines when the Command can execute.
The scheduler to publish events on - default is RxApp.DeferredScheduler.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveCommand.Create(System.Func{System.Object,System.Boolean},System.Action{System.Object},System.Reactive.Concurrency.IScheduler)
member.summary: Creates a new ReactiveCommand object in an imperative, non-Rx way, similar to RelayCommand.
member.param: A function that determines when the Command can execute.
A method that will be invoked when the Execute method is invoked.
The scheduler to publish events on - default is RxApp.DeferredScheduler.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveCommand.Create(System.Func{System.Object,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{System.Boolean}},System.Action{System.Object},System.Reactive.Concurrency.IScheduler)
member.summary: Creates a new ReactiveCommand object in an imperative, non-Rx way, similar to RelayCommand, only via a TPL Async method
member.param: A function that determines when the Command can execute.
A method that will be invoked when the Execute method is invoked.
The scheduler to publish events on - default is RxApp.DeferredScheduler.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveCommand.CanExecuteObservable
member.summary: Fires whenever the CanExecute of the ICommand changes.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryCommand.#ctor(System.String,System.Func{System.Object,ReactiveUI.Xaml.RecoveryOptionResult})
member.summary: Constructs a RecoveryCommand.
member.param: The user-visible name of this Command.
A convenience handler - equivalent to Subscribing to the command and setting the RecoveryResult.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.DependencyPropertyMixin.ObservableFromDP``2(``0,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,``1}})
member.summary: Creates an IObservable from an existing dependency property. Note that this method is somewhat expensive and should not be called frequently.
member.param: An Expression specifying the property to use on the DependencyObject (e.g. x => x.SomeProperty)
member.returns: An Observable that fires whenever the DP changes, and never completes.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.IReactiveAsyncCommand
member.summary: IReactiveAsyncCommand represents commands that run an asynchronous operation in the background when invoked.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.IReactiveAsyncCommand.ItemsInflight
member.summary: Fires whenever the number of asynchronous operations in-flight (i.e. currently running) changes and provides the new Count.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.IReactiveAsyncCommand.AsyncStartedNotification
member.summary: Should be fired whenever an async operation starts.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.IReactiveAsyncCommand.AsyncCompletedNotification
member.summary: Should be fired whenever an async operation completes.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveAsyncCommand
member.summary: ReactiveAsyncCommand represents commands that run an asynchronous operation in the background when invoked. The main benefit of this command is that it will keep track of in-flight operations and disable/enable CanExecute when there are too many of them (i.e. a "Search" button shouldn't have many concurrent requests running if the user clicks the button many times quickly)

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveAsyncCommand.#ctor(System.IObservable{System.Boolean},System.Int32,System.Reactive.Concurrency.IScheduler)
member.summary: Constructs a new ReactiveAsyncCommand.
member.param: An Observable representing when the command can execute. If null, the Command can always execute.
The maximum number of in-flight operations at a time - defaults to one.
The scheduler to run the asynchronous operations on - defaults to the Taskpool scheduler.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveAsyncCommand.Create``1(System.Func{System.Object,``0},System.Action{``0},System.Func{System.Object,System.Boolean},System.Int32,System.Reactive.Concurrency.IScheduler)
member.summary: Create is a helper method to create a basic ReactiveAsyncCommand in a non-Rx way, closer to how BackgroundWorker works.
member.param: The function that will calculate results in the background
The method to be called once the calculation function completes. This method is guaranteed to be called on the UI thread.
The maximum number of in-flight operations at a time - defaults to one.
The scheduler to run the asynchronous operations on - defaults to the Taskpool scheduler.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveAsyncCommand.RegisterAsyncFunction``1(System.Func{System.Object,``0},System.Reactive.Concurrency.IScheduler)
member.summary: RegisterAsyncFunction registers an asynchronous method that returns a result to be called whenever the Command's Execute method is called.
member.param: The function to be run in the background.
member.returns: An Observable that will fire on the UI thread once per invoecation of Execute, once the async method completes. Subscribe to this to retrieve the result of the calculationFunc.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveAsyncCommand.RegisterAsyncAction(System.Action{System.Object},System.Reactive.Concurrency.IScheduler)
member.summary: RegisterAsyncAction registers an asynchronous method that runs whenever the Command's Execute method is called and doesn't return a result.
member.param: The function to be run in the background.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveAsyncCommand.RegisterAsyncTask``1(System.Func{System.Object,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}})
member.summary: RegisterAsyncTask registers an TPL/Async method that runs when a Command gets executed and returns the result
member.returns: An Observable that will fire on the UI thread once per invoecation of Execute, once the async method completes. Subscribe to this to retrieve the result of the calculationFunc.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveAsyncCommand.RegisterAsyncTask``1(System.Func{System.Object,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: RegisterAsyncTask registers an TPL/Async method that runs when a Command gets executed and returns no result.
member.param: The function to be run in the background.
member.returns: An Observable that signals when the Task completes, on the UI thread.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveAsyncCommand.RegisterAsyncObservable``1(System.Func{System.Object,System.IObservable{``0}})
member.summary: RegisterAsyncObservable registers an Rx-based async method whose results will be returned on the UI thread.
member.param: A calculation method that returns a future result, such as a method returned via Observable.FromAsyncPattern.
member.returns: An Observable representing the items returned by the calculation result. Note that with this method it is possible with a calculationFunc to return multiple items per invocation of Execute.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveAsyncCommand.RegisterMemoizedFunction``1(System.Func{System.Object,``0},System.Int32,System.Action{``0},System.Reactive.Concurrency.IScheduler)
member.summary: RegisterMemoizedFunction is similar to RegisterAsyncFunction, but caches its results so that subsequent Execute calls with the same CommandParameter will not need to be run in the background.
member.param:
The function that performs the expensive or asyncronous calculation and returns the result.
Note that this function *must* return an equivalently-same result given a specific input - because the function is being memoized, if the calculationFunc depends on other varables other than the input value, the results will be unpredictable.
The number of items to cache. When this limit is reached, not recently used items will be discarded.

This optional method is called when an item is evicted from the cache - this can be used to clean up / manage an on-disk cache; the calculationFunc can download a file and save it to a temporary folder, and the onRelease action will delete the file.
The scheduler to run asynchronous operations on - defaults to TaskpoolScheduler
member.returns: An Observable that will fire on the UI thread once per invocation of Execute, once the async method completes. Subscribe to this to retrieve the result of the calculationFunc.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveAsyncCommand.RegisterMemoizedObservable``1(System.Func{System.Object,System.IObservable{``0}},System.Int32,System.Action{``0},System.Reactive.Concurrency.IScheduler)
member.summary: RegisterMemoizedObservable is similar to RegisterAsyncObservable, but caches its results so that subsequent Execute calls with the same CommandParameter will not need to be run in the background.
member.param:
The function that performs the expensive or asyncronous calculation and returns the result.
Note that this function *must* return an equivalently-same result given a specific input - because the function is being memoized, if the calculationFunc depends on other varables other than the input value, the results will be unpredictable.
The number of items to cache. When this limit is reached, not recently used items will be discarded.

This optional method is called when an item is evicted from the cache - this can be used to clean up / manage an on-disk cache; the calculationFunc can download a file and save it to a temporary folder, and the onRelease action will delete the file.
The scheduler to run asynchronous operations on - defaults to TaskpoolScheduler
member.returns: An Observable representing the items returned by the calculation result. Note that with this method it is possible with a calculationFunc to return multiple items per invocation of Execute.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveAsyncCommandMixins.CurrentItemsInFlight(ReactiveUI.Xaml.IReactiveAsyncCommand)
member.summary: This method returns the current number of items in flight.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveCommandMixins.ToCommand(System.IObservable{System.Boolean},System.Reactive.Concurrency.IScheduler)
member.summary: ToCommand is a convenience method for returning a new ReactiveCommand based on an existing Observable chain.
member.param: The scheduler to publish events on - default is RxApp.DeferredScheduler.
member.returns: A new ReactiveCommand whose CanExecute Observable is the current object.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.ReactiveCommandMixins.InvokeCommand``1(System.IObservable{``0},System.Windows.Input.ICommand)
member.summary: A utility method that will pipe an Observable to an ICommand (i.e. it will first call its CanExecute with the provided value, then if the command can be executed, Execute() will be called)
member.param: The command to be executed.
member.returns: An object that when disposes, disconnects the Observable from the command.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl
member.summary: A ContentControl that animates the transition when its content is changed.

member.summary: for the property.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionPartProperty
member.summary: for the property.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.OnContentChanged(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Called when the value of the property changes.
member.param: The old value of the property.
The new value of the property.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.AbortTransition
member.summary: Aborts the transition.

member.name: M:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.SetTransitionDefaultValues
member.summary: Sets default values for certain transition types.

member.name: E:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when a transition has completed.

member.name: E:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionStarted
member.summary: Occurs when a transition has started.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.Transition
member.summary: Gets or sets the transition.

member.name: P:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionPart
member.summary: Gets or sets the transition part.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionType
member.summary: Represents the type of transition that a TransitioningContentControl will perform.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionType.Fade
member.summary: A simple fading transition.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionType.FadeDown
member.summary: A transition that fades the new element in from the top.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionType.SlideLeft
member.summary: A transition that slides old content left and out of view, then slides new content back in from the same direction.

member.name: T:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionPartType
member.summary: Represents the part of the transition that the developer would like the TransitioningContentControl to perform
member.remarks: This only applies to certain TransitionTypes. An InvalidOperationException will be thrown if the TransitionType does not support the TransitionPartType. Default is OutIn.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionPartType.Out
member.summary: Transitions out only.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionPartType.In
member.summary: Transitions in only.

member.name: F:ReactiveUI.Xaml.TransitioningContentControl.TransitionPartType.OutIn
member.summary: Transitions in and out.
